name: William Robert BERNARD, Jr., petitioner, v. MINNESOTA.

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties:
William Robert BERNARD, Jr., petitioner,
v.
MINNESOTA.
attorneys: Motion of the Solicitor General for leave to participate in oral argument as amicus curiae, for enlargement of time for oral argument, and for divided argument granted and the time is divided as follows: 35 minutes for petitioners, 15 minutes for respondent North Dakota, 10 minutes for respondent Minnesota, and 10 minutes for the Solicitor General.
casebody.head_matter:
William Robert BERNARD, Jr., petitioner,
v.
MINNESOTA.
No. 14-1470.
Supreme Court of the United States
April 4, 2016.
Motion of the Solicitor General for leave to participate in oral argument as amicus curiae, for enlargement of time for oral argument, and for divided argument granted and the time is divided as follows: 35 minutes for petitioners, 15 minutes for respondent North Dakota, 10 minutes for respondent Minnesota, and 10 minutes for the Solicitor General.
